description: From Middle English wacche word, wacchworde, morphologically as watch (“guard, sentinel, sentry”) +‎ word.

entries.meaning: A word used as a motto, as expressive of a principle, belief, or rule of action; a rallying cry.
examples: Synonyms: catchword, byword, maxim, mantra, motto

entries.meaning: (military, security) A prearranged reply to the challenge of a sentry or a guard; a password or signal by which friends can be known from enemies.
